intro: Fatoua, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas and is often found in disturbed soils. Fatoua has a taproot system and can thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a resilient species. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
